title: Proving Lee Sin is numerically Overpowered by comparing him to every other Warrior Enchant Jungler
body:
**TLDR AT BOTTOM AND LOTS OF MATH WARNING SO MUCH MATH WOW**

{{item:3707}} built on AD Junglers that usually build almost full tank after this item

The following is each AD Jungler that fits this criteria listed in order of their damage increases from this item

{{champion:62}} 240.75 more damage **with abilities** (80% Bonus AD + 455% Total AD Ratios)
{{champion:80}} 225 more damage **with abilities**  (500% Bonus AD Ratios)
{{champion:64}} 216 more damage **with abilities**  (480% Bonus AD Ratios)
{{champion:121}} 171 more damage **with abilities**  (380% Bonus AD Ratios)
{{champion:421}} 166.5 more damage **with abilities**  (130% Bonus AD + 240% Total AD Ratios)
{{champion:56}} 141.75 more damage **with abilities**  (195% Bonus AD + 120% Total AD Ratios)
{{champion:254}} 141.75 more damage **with abilities**  (300% Bonus AD + 15% Total AD Ratios)
{{champion:59}} 121.5 more damage **with abilities**  (270% Bonus AD Ratios)
{{champion:14}} 117 more damage **with abilities**  (80% Bonus AD + 180% Total AD Ratios)

____________________________

{{champion:254}}{{champion:64}} both have health damage, but the latter doesn't have to work for it and has higher ratios
{{champion:62}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:64}} all have high ratios and damage potential, but the former 2 have to channel their abilities to deal that damage

Lets now look at base damages of those AD ratio scaling **abilities** for the top 3

{{champion:62}} 1190 (Q/E/R)
{{champion:64}} 1140 (Q/E/R)
{{champion:80}} 545 (Q/E)

Now lets look at the top 2 in terms of base damage **ability** potential in 1 second

{{champion:62}} 590
{{champion:64}} 1140

In 2 seconds

{{champion:62}} 790
{{champion:64}} 1140

In 3 seconds

{{champion:62}} 990
{{champion:64}} 1140

In 4 seconds

{{champion:62}} 1190
{{champion:64}} 1140

____________________________

So this calls for a direct **ability damage** comparison between {{champion:62}}  and {{champion:64}}  since they deal the most damage with both ratios and bases in an AoE

Q: {{champion:62}} 9/8/7/6/5 CD, 150(+10% Total AD) as an enhanced auto against one target
Q: {{champion:64}} 11/10/9/8/7 CD, 170(+90% Bonus AD) + 170(+90% Bonus AD)(+8% Target's Missing Health) to one target

Lee's Q is higher range, lower CD for most of the game since Wukong maxes Q second and deals FAR more damage than Wu's Q

E: {{champion:62}} 8 CD, 240(+80% Bonus AD) Physical Damage to 3 targets maximum but is a gap closer
E: {{champion:64}} 10 CD, 200(+100% Bonus AD) Magic Damage to any targets around him

Wu's E potentially does more damage and gives him AS, but Lee gets AS every time he uses an ability technically. Wu's E gives him a gap closer that he didn't have, but its targeted and not freeform like Lee's Q and W. Still giving the win to Lee here. 

R: {{champion:62}}  120/105/90 CD, 200(+110% Total AD) Physical Damage per second over 4 seconds for a maximum of 800(+440% Total AD)
R: {{champion:64}} 90/75/60 CD, 600(+200% Bonus AD) Physical Damage to all targets hit

Both provide a knockup, both provide high AoE physical damage. Lee R is always a lower CD by far than Wu's R. Wu can deal more damage than Lee's but he has to hit a Champion for at least 2.5 seconds to deal more damage than his R. 

________

**TLDR: {{champion:64}} abilities are faster, lower CD, easier and better than any of his competitors like {{champion:62}}  and {{champion:80}} that have to extend and stay in an area for an extended period in order to out damage him**

He should fall off in damage, which he doesn't currently when every single jungler of his type builds Warrior Enchant + Full Tank. He currently doesn't really fall off honestly with 480% Bonus AD Ratios and 1140 base damage. 

Is Lee a Tank or a Bruiser or an Assassin? He does all 3 things really well. What is he supposed to do? What is not supposed to do?

> He should fall off in damage, which he doesn't currently when every single jungler of his type builds Warrior Enchant + Full Tank. He currently doesn't really fall off honestly with 480% Bonus AD Ratios and 1140 base damage. 

Again, this is not a good choice of weakness for a jungler.  It can work for laners, but jungling is all about the early game snowball.  Designing a jungler who is strong early and weak late just gives your balance team an impossible problem to solve.

> Is Lee a Tank or a Bruiser or an Assassin? He does all 3 things really well. What is he supposed to do? What is not supposed to do?

This is pretty much hitting on the design problem.  Lee isn't designed to have strengths and weaknesses.  He's not great at anything, but he's good at everything,  Many fighter kits from that era have this problem.

The solution is a rework to give him meaningful strengths and weaknesses.  Myself, I would like to make him more interested in actually using his autoattacks.  Take damage off abilities, add damage to passive, focus Lee on being a bruiser with good sustained damage and high utility.  The game doesn't have enough high utility bruiser types anyway, so it seems a good niche.

{{champion:80}} is an early game aggressive ganking jungler that falls off late. He does high damage but not instantly, has minimal utility and provides damage in only really 2 skills that are both low range. He is easy to balance this way.

Lee needs less sustain and the shield removed and his R damage reduced, but maybe the CD reduced so its always useful for the utility it brings.

> {{champion:80}} is an early game aggressive ganking jungler that falls off late. He does high damage but not instantly, has minimal utility and provides damage in only really 2 skills that are both low range. He is easy to balance this way.

Pantheon hasn't been at all easy to balance.  He's either an OP jungler or he's out of the meta.  His core play patterns lack counterplay, and he has really limited ability to outplay anyone.  Super not recommended game design here.

> Lee needs less sustain and the shield removed and his R damage reduced, but maybe the CD reduced so its always useful for the utility it brings.

They could nerf Lee sustain and remove the shield.  I'm not convinced that really makes people happier about playing against Lee though.  Also, I think it makes the W button feel pretty lame.  

I think the thing that people hate about playing against Lee is how on the one hand he can burst them down, and on the other he's really safe.  Would recommend looking at either one of those characteristics to make him feel better.

Honestly Pantheon was only ever OP because of Dragon being coded weird and Lizard Item just being overpowered. It had nothing to do with his kit.

Pantheon has been nerfed and changed so many times in LoL history because he's a pain in the ass to balance with his stun, burst and ult. They have changed what damage skill he max first, nerfed the stun, nerfed the ult, finally expelled from mid lane, didn't like him in the jungle either and got nerfed again. He hasn't been easy to balance at all.

Out of the meta? He has a very good pick rate. He's picked for his good early game and he DOES fall off once teamfights come. He's kind of like Malzahar in that regard. Just because something is not fotm or broken atm doesn't meant it's "out of the meta".

So far this year, Pantheon has been picked twice in competitive play across NA, EU, CN, and KR.  Dude is not in the meta.

Presumably, when you're talking about pick rate, you're talking about solo queue.  My response there is simple: who cares?  The game shouldn't be balanced around random silver players overextending into easymode Pantheon ganks, but instead balanced around reasonably correct play.
I was talking about his pick rate in Diamond, 16-17%.
I keep wondering at what point people will realize you are just arguing whatever, whenever, wherever just to argue, and stop feeding the troll.

We could do a similar experiment with many skills.  A great example would be Olaf ult on Yi.  Just because that would be broken as heck doesn't mean that Olaf is better than Yi.

I would also argue that an invisible Wukong suddenly kicking you into his team with no warning would be pretty broken.

Certainly, this technique doesn't work when there are particularly strong synergies between buttons across champions.  It's a good point, and worth keeping in mind.

However, Wukong R doesn't have particular synergy with Lee Sin's kit.  Actually, Wukong has an easier time getting into good position to use it than Lee does.  Meanwhile, even though Wukong does have a decent amount of synergy with Lee R, there's absolutely no way he'd prefer to have Lee's R over his own.

Taken together, this is a pretty easy argument for Wukong R being the stronger button.

I will admit that Wukong's ult may be stronger than Lee's, but I feel it is less all-purpose.

The cooldown and utility differences are pretty big.  Wu can't split you from your team or knock you away from the squishy you were trying to kill, but Lee is less likely to be able to knock up everyone.  I feel Lee's ult is just another example of him being a strong Jack-of-all-Trades, while Wu's is fairly limited in it's scope of usability.

There are some situations where I would rather have the Wu ult, but there are at least as many where I would rather have Lee's.
Not only is this true, but this is only taking into account **damage**, which many people don't even say is the worst part of Lee's kit. His ult's AD ratio alone is a joke.

I think Lee would be just fine with removal of the 8% missing health on his Q and a nerf to his R cooldown. At that point, he can no longer use his ult as an effective means of assassination without risking not having it for another 140/120/105 seconds (or whatever a better CD would be). Then remove the missing health on his Q and he's forced to rely on his QE combo, making him resemble a Triforce Alistar of sorts. 

I'm fine with his mobility as long as he has less burst as a bruiser. If they want to keep those high ratios, push him out of the jungle and make him a midlane utility carry.

Actually, pushing it to 120/105/90 like Wukong would be pretty fair. 60 seconds is really crazy for an ultimate with that much power.

Shifting the power of Q1 to Q2 and removing the missing health damage seems pretty fair as well.

Things to consider:

* Basic attack calculations are **vital** to your point (I know other people have said this). Just ability calculations would favor certain champions over others.

 * Rek Sai's Q damage always includes her auto damage. Ignoring basic attacks, is ignoring a good chunk of her damage.

 * Noct will out-duel Lee if he spellshields Lee's Q; his passive also involves a basic attack

 * Vi's E and Wukong's Q involve a basic attack and the ability to reset their auto timer 

 * Vi's W, Wukong's E, and Lee's passive give attack speed. (Only important in sustained fights)

* Wukong's Q shreds armor

* Base damages should be looked at for all the champions, not just the 3 with the highest ratios

I might be missing some stuff, but you **need** to consider at least some of these points, if you want to use numbers as proof of how OP Lee is. Otherwise this just shows who has higher ratios (which we can already see).

Also, Wukong's R knocks enemies up, guaranteeing at least 2 free hits, and Pantheon's W stuns, guaranteeing his entire combo for free.

I'm not saying Lee is fine, but your calculations don't prove hes broken unless you consider variables.

EDIT: One more thing. Wukong's R deals damage every second.
Based on what you said, wukong is the second best jungler. Not correct. Junglers are good based on their utility in abilities. This is why J4 is so good. Your math just does not hold up dude, sorry.
